questionTitle: The human ear <u><font color='red'>cannot</font></u> hear a sound <u><font color='red'>that</font></u> vibrates <u><font color='red'>less than</font></u> 16 times <u><font color='red'>the</font></u> second.

Some <u><font color='red'>tree</font></u> frogs <u><font color='red'>can alter</font></u> their colors <u><font color='red'>in order</font></u> to blend <u><font color='red'>to</font></u> their environment.

If <u><font color='red'>one</font></u> is invited <u><font color='red'>out</font></u> to a dinner, it is perfectly proper <u><font color='red'>to go</font></u> either with or without <u><font color='red'>no</font></u> a gift.
When the police eventually found my wallet, it was completely ________.
It was a sad day when the factory finally closed and the workers were all ________.
You will become ill ________ you stop working so hard .
The sooner we leave this terrible hotel, the ________!
You won't need an umbrella after all: the weather seems to be ________.
When you stay in a country for some time you get used to the people's ________ of life.
We can no longer afford the cost of ________ two cars, so we're selling one.
A soldier has to learn to carry ________ orders as soon as they are given.
Too many footballers these days refuse to ________ the referee's decision.
It's not fair that I ________ always have to do the washing-up.
I don't think Nicole will have any problems at the interview: she's a very self-________ young lady.
Last summer was so hot that the ________ in the wood actually dried up.
It is over a year ________ I visited the dentist.
There's an interesting job ________ in today's newspaper.
The drawing lessons usually start ________ 4 p.m.
I though you said that you were ________ to be in Spain this weekend .
Motorway traffic was ________ after a lorry overturned and spilt its load over the northbound carriageway.
Being described by the Americans as a homemaker seems infinitely preferable to being referred to as a(n) ________ housewife.
I wish they ________ change their minds so often!
The Tabors lived a life thought to be ________ even by their contemporaries.
